contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox pageant titleholder | name = | title = [[Miss Peru|Miss Peru 1957]]<br>[[Miss Universe 1957]] | competitions= [[Miss Peru|Miss Peru 1957]]<br>(Winner)<br>[[Miss Universe 1957]]<br>(Winner) | photo = | caption = Gladys Zender is crowned by [[Carol Morris]] | occupation = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1938|10|19}} | birth_place = Contamana - Loreto [[Perú]] | birth_name = Gladys Rosa Zender Urbina | height={{convert|1.70|m|ftin|abbr=on}}<ref name=lodi /> | weight = {{convert|56.5|kg|lb |abbr=on}}<ref name=lodi /> | eye_color = [[Brown eyes|Brown]]<ref name=lodi /> | hair_color= [[Black hair|Black]]<ref name=lodi /> | measurements = 91-60-91 (36-23.5-36)<ref name=lodi /> }} '''Gladys Rosa Zender de Meier''' ([[married and maiden names#Spanish-speaking_world|née]] '''Zender Urbina'''; born October 19, 1938) is a [[beauty queen]] from [[Peru]] who became the first [[Latin America]]n woman to win the [[Miss Universe]] title.<ref name="montreal" /> ==Miss Universe== Born to a [[Swiss people|Swiss]] father and a Peruvian mother, she obtained the title of [[Miss Universe 1957]] in [[Long Beach, California|Long Beach]], [[California]], [[United States]]. After being crowned, it was revealed that she was only 17 years old, a few months under the contest's minimum age requirement. Pageant officials decided that she could keep the crown, after they were told she was considered to be 18 in Peru.<ref name="montreal" /> That same year, [[Miss USA]], [[Mary Leona Gage]], was stripped of her title and disqualified from the semifinals of the Miss Universe pageant after it was revealed she was a married mother of two children. Miss Argentina, Mónica Lamas, replaced her as one of the 15 semifinalists. ==Return to Peru== Zender became an instant celebrity.{{Citation needed|date=October 2010}} *She flew on the inaugural flight from [[JFK International Airport|Idlewild International Airport]] in [[New York City]], [[New York]], to [[Jorge Chavez International Airport]] in [[Lima]], Peru, where she was greeted by thousands of fans. *''[[Caretas]]'', one of Peru's most-popular [[newsmagazine]]s, soon featured Zender on their cover. She was also later featured on that publication's first all-color cover. *The Peruvian composer Alicia Maguina created a song called "Polka a Gladys Zender" (Polka dedicated to Gladys Zender). It was also titled "La más hermosa" (The most beautiful) and was recorded by the Peruvian group [[Los Troveros Criollos]]. ==Personal life== Zender married Antonio Meier in 1965, and secluded herself into a family life; they had four children together. Their son, [[Christian Meier]], is a well-known actor and singer in Peru and has achieved some fame in other Latin American countries. In 2003, Zender allowed ''Caretas'' to photograph her (and Meier's) home showcasing various artifacts, including a collection of [[Inca]]n art, the couple have acquired through their years together. ==References== {{reflist|refs=<ref name=lodi>{{cite news|title=Peruvian beauty, new Miss Universe |url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=tXIzAAAAIBAJ&sjid=zu4HAAAAIBAJ&dq=&pg=4254%2C2246374|accessdate=10-12-2010|newspaper=[[Lodi News-Sentinel]]|date=July 20, 1957|agency=[[United Press]]}}</ref><ref name="montreal">{{cite news|title=Whew! She's crowned, but it sure was work|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=5oItAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cJkFAAAAIBAJ&dq=&pg=2507%2C3736810|agency=[[Associated Press]]|accessdate=10-12-2010|newspaper=[[The Gazette (Montreal){{!}}The Montreal Gazette]]|date=July 22, 1957}}</ref>}} ==External links== * [http://www.lostroveroscriollos.com/video.php?contentID=107 Waltz for Gladys Zender] Peruvian waltz dedicated to Gladys Zender * [http://www.lostroveroscriollos.com/video.php?contentID=141 Polka for Gladys Zender] Peruvian polka dedicated to Gladys Zender. {{s-start}} {{S-ach}} {{succession box | before = Lola Sabogal | title = [[Miss Peru]] | years = 1957 | after = Beatriz Boluarte }} {{succession box | before = [[Carol Morris]] | title = [[Miss Universe]] | years = 1957 | after = [[Luz Marina Zuluaga]] }} {{s-end}} {{MissUniverses 1952–1959}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]] --> | NAME = Zender, Gladys | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Peruvian model | DATE OF BIRTH = October 19, 1939 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Contamana - Loreto | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zender, Gladys}} [[Category:1939 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Peruvian female models]] [[Category:Miss Universe winners]] [[Category:Miss Universe 1957 contestants]] [[Category:Peruvian beauty pageant winners]] {{peru-bio-stub}} {{model-stub}}
